Class BankAccount

java.lang.Object
  BankAccount

public class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object

The purpose of this class is to create and manage a Bank Account.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alfonso Leone

Constructor Summary
BankAccount(int aBalance)
          This is the Bank Account constructor which takes an initial balance as parameter and then creates a new ArrayList of transactions
 
Method Summary
 void addTransaction(int type, int value, long threadId)
          This method creates an instance of a Transaction class and stores it inside the ArrayList transactions.

          This is the method used to deposit.

          This is a simple method which prints out all the instances of Transaction stored inside the ArrayList transactions.

          This is the method used to withdraw.

Constructor Detail

BankAccount

public BankAccount(int aBalance)
This is the Bank Account constructor which takes an initial balance as parameter and then creates a new ArrayList of transactions

Parameters:
aBalance - initial balance
Method Detail

getBalance

public int getBalance()

setBalance

public void setBalance(int balance)

withdraw

public void withdraw(int amount)
This is the method used to withdraw. Before withdrawing it checks if there is money to withdraw and if not it makes the thread asking for withdraw to wait

Parameters:
amount - how much money to withdraw

deposit

public void deposit(int amount)
This is the method used to deposit. After depositing money it notifies all the possible waiting threads that there is money to withdraw.

Parameters:
amount - how much money to deposit

addTransaction

public void addTransaction(int type,
                           int value,
                           long threadId)
This method creates an instance of a Transaction class and stores it inside the ArrayList transactions. This method also stores the actual value of balance when the transaction is just made from a thread.

Parameters:
type - it can be a Transaction.WITHDRAWAL or Transaction.DEPOSIT
value - how much money to deposit or withdraw
threadId - the Id of the thread responsible for the transaction

printTransactions

public void printTransactions()
This is a simple method which prints out all the instances of Transaction stored inside the ArrayList transactions. There is an IF statement to determine whether the value of the transaction has to be printed below the deposit or withdrawal column.
